==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|べん|しょ|k2=じょ|yomi=o|r=y}}

===Etymology===
{{lb|ja|literally|place for convenience}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|べんじょ}}

# {{lb|ja|dated|sort=べんじょ}} [[bathroom]], [[restroom]], [[lavatory]], [[toilet]]

====Usage notes====
While previously (1970s) this term, or the honorific {{m|ja|お便所|tr=o-benjo}} was the preferred polite term to refer to a bathroom, it has now been largely replaced with {{m|ja|お手洗い||washroom|tr=o-tearai}} – or even {{m|ja|トイレ||toilet|tr=toire}} – and sounds dated if used.

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|トイレ}}, {{ja-r|おトイレ|お-トイレ}}
* {{ja-r|手洗い|てあらい}}, {{ja-r|お手洗い|おてあらい|washroom}}
* {{m|ja|化粧室||[[lavatory]]|tr=keshōshitsu|lit=make-up room, [[powder room]]}} – used in public spaces, like shops or airplane, more as the written sign than in speech.

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|お便所|お-べんじょ}}
